channel.title: Comments on: “WSGI from Start to Finish” at EuroPython 2010
channel.description: Notes from a disciplined software developer

item.title: By: John Griessen
item.dc:creator: John Griessen
item.description:
I'm not yet published in python, but I like it and have made some free published open hardware for biologists and have more in planning. Would twodegrees membership benefit an open hardware developer?
I'd like to know more about WSGI. If you have anything you can share I promise not to bug you about it. I'll be trying out twod.wsgi soon.
John Austin Texas
item.content:encoded:
I’m not yet published in python, but I like it and have made
some free published open hardware for biologists
and have more in planning. Would twodegrees membership benefit
an open hardware developer?

I’d like to know more about WSGI. If you have anything you can share
I promise not to bug you about it. I’ll be trying out twod.wsgi soon.

John
Austin Texas

item.title: By: Gustavo
item.dc:creator: Gustavo
item.description:
That'd be nice! Although I'm not sure if someone else from the development team will go too.
I'll keep in touch via email! :)
- Gustavo.
item.content:encoded:
That’d be nice! Although I’m not sure if someone else from the development team will go too.

I’ll keep in touch via email!

– Gustavo.

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description:
Hi Gustavo,
I'm doing a talk at EuroPython too! It's going to be on the websocket/repoze/eventlet stuff I've been hacking on.
We should catch up while we're there! Is anyone else from 2 degrees coming?
Ben
item.content:encoded:
Hi Gustavo,

I’m doing a talk at EuroPython too! It’s going to be on the websocket/repoze/eventlet stuff I’ve been hacking on.

We should catch up while we’re there! Is anyone else from 2 degrees coming?

Ben
